title: Why 49ers fans are blowing up
text:
San Francisco 49ers fans are so angry at the club they are re-selling Season ticket holders JAMES MATTHEY news.com.au San Francisco 49ers fans are so angry at the club they are re-selling Season ticket holders JAMES MATTHEY news.com.au San Francisco 49ers say Jarryd Hayne won't kick return 1:42 
NFL: The San Francisco 49ers say Jarryd Hayne is impressing as a punt returner, but won't be given dual punt and kick returning duties October 1st 2015 a day ago /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/More Sports/ 
IF YOU thought San Franciso 49ers fans were queuing for miles to buy tickets to watch their team — and in particular, Jarryd Hayne in action — think again. 
Not even the lure of seeing the NFL’s most intriguing player has been enough to convince ’Niners supporters to fork out their hard earned Benjamin Franklins to see their heroes in the flesh. 
In fact, just the opposite is happening — they’re trying to give their tickets away. 
Thousands of 49ers Season Builders Licenses (SLBs) have become available after angry fans wanted to show their dissatisfaction with how the club is operating, selling their licenses because they have no intention of going to another game this season. 
SLBs give owners exclusive rights to purchase 49ers season tickets, and priority access to other events at Levi’s Stadium — the 49ers’ home ground. 
Bizarrely, this mentality has very little to do with the team’s on-field performance. Hayne starred in their first round win over the Minnesota Vikings, but the side has since suffered heavy losses to the Pittsburgh Steelers (43-18) and Arizona Cardinals (47-7). Other Stories
